column4: I believe Applications->System Tools->Configuration Editor then /apps/totem is what you want
You told gstreamer to use alsa and you're using totem-gstreamer?
no, i'm using all kinds of audio players, and no one works
except for the '/usr/bin/X11: Is a directory, no
Then your sound works, it's just muted.
i've checked and it is not muted. or i missed something
when i try playing an mp3 in mpd it starts playing for about 1 second and then it stops again, and you hear nothing. that's why i think sound isn't muted
I don't think Ubuntu really has different (X vs non-X) runlevels
so when i've installed X i can't boot without X anymore?
i wanted to use init 3 as a default runlevel
I don't believe so, unless you customize the run levels.
There is a GUI tool for that, I believe it's called BUM
